results.title: Reproductive technology: facts and issues
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Pearl, Neil Barrett and Environment Audio Visuals
results.brief_description: This video is designed for students in years 10-12. Part one looks at recent technological advances in the field of reproduction and Part two raises some of the legal and ethical issues involved in such technology.

results.title: Report: Endeavour anchor
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Don Murray, Australia. Dept. of Transport and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The recovery and restoration of the anchor abandoned by explorer Captain James Cook on the Great Barrier Reef in 1770. Shows the search for the missing anchor by Australian scientists, and its discovery on the sea bed on Christmas Day, 1971.

results.title: Working
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Six of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Caring
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program visits Minus Eighteen Street in northern Harbin (Ha-erh-pin) to examine urban life in China, using the family of a railway policeman as an example. Also looks at institutions for those with whom the community cannot cope. Highlights how life is governed by concepts of honour, moral conduct, courtesy and respectful behaviour which are deep rooted in Chinese society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Rendez-vous France. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: Sue Weeks, Susan Paton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A series of five french language programs based on the adventures of the Keravec family on holiday in Cancale, Brittany. Provides elementary french language and gives an insight into many aspects of life in France. The individual titles indicate the content of each program: “Chez Keravec”, “Les surprises” “Une ombre du passe”, “Les choux-fleurs de Saint-Brieuc”, “La chasse a mort”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Weeks, Susan Paton and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Mediating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is about the breakdown of a marriage and the pressures that are brought on the couple to reconcile their differences. Highlights that, in China, society comes before the individual and the family must be maintained, whatever the cost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Rendez-Vous de L'ete = Summer Rendez-Vous
results.brief_description:
This documentary profiles the various disciplines making up Track and Field Athletics as well as coaching techniques.

Credits: Director, Jacques Ertaud ; editor, Emma le Chanois.

results.title: Eating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program contrasts food habits and agricultural conditions in China and considers how long China can continue to support a population which, despite birth control, continues to grow at an alarming rate.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
